subject: RE: [junit] Asserts
msgSnippet: from the zip file junit3.5 javadoc junit framework Assert.html class junit.framework.Assert which is extended by junit.framework.TestCase assertEquals public
messageBody:
from the zip file
junit3.5\javadoc\junit\framework\Assert.html



class
junit.framework.Assert which is extended by junit.framework.TestCase

assertEquals
public static void assertEquals(int expected,
int actual)
Asserts that two ints are equal.



if the assertion fails, it is recorded. When the suite of tests is done, it
should show up.

Michael Finney
Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform


> -----Original Message-----
> From: tamago000@... [SMTP:tamago000@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2001 1:57 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Asserts
>
> Hi. I am relatively new to both Junit and Java in general. I hope
> you guys will bear with me here. What are all the assert methods
> used for in Junit? I cant seem to find anything in the documentation
> for junit that will explain them. For example, what is the purpose
> of assertEquals? Here is the document I was looking at:
>
> <http://www.objectmentor.com/publications/xpepisode.htm>
>
> And here is the code in question:
>
> public class TestFrame extends TestCase
> {
> public TestFrame( String name )
> {
> super( name );
> }
>
> public void testScoreNoThrows()
> {
> Frame f = new Frame();
> assertEquals( 0, f.getScore() );
> }
> }
>
> What is it that assertequals is doing here? Is this some kind of if-
> then statement to find out if the f.getScore method returns a 0? I
> am confused.
>
> Any help here would be very appreciated.
>
> Ed Goble
>
